plot outline: A reporter who writes about places of historic locations, Ganesh, travels to a village for his new story. His friend Vishwa stays in a nearby town and hence Ganesh decides to stay with him. However, upon reaching his house, he is shocked to find out that he is no more, leaving his aging mother and a young widow.
title: Seethamma Bandalu Sirimallige Thottu
plot: A reporter who writes about places of historic locations, Ganesh, travels to a village for his new story. His friend Vishwa stays in a nearby town and hence Ganesh decides to stay with him. However, upon reaching his house, he is shocked to find out that he is no more, leaving his aging mother and a young widow.

A scintillating tale of relationships, misunderstandings, expectations, old rituals, extending our generations and lot more. - Probably you have seen all this in many movies, in many dialects and many forms ...but what's so new and exhilarating is Director Ashok Kadaba's exuberant script....with a thrilling end - the brilliant portrayal of human emotions and its unsatisfactory needs from others.....well it's a journey that you will envisage in this movies, what we have witnessed in our lives in bits and pieces and at the end you will be left to ponder is life a sum of expectations buried by the feeling of what's right and wrong.
